info.title: API
info.description:
Trade derivatives on the **[Lightning Network](https://lightning.network/)**.
You can find our website **[here](https://lnmarkets.com/)**.

tags.name: Login
tags.description: Here you can find the different way to auth yourself on LN Markets, mostly use for browser.

tags.name: Positions
tags.description: Interactions with the market and retrive your positions

tags.name: User
tags.description: You can retrieve your user data and modify it

tags.name: State
tags.description: LN Markets state with data about our node and api availability

tags.name: LNURL
tags.description:
Interaction with the lightning network using the [LNURL procotocol](https://github.com/btcontract/lnurl-rfc/)
LNURL enable simple auth process and easier withdraw

get.description: Generates an invoice for future use in the account creation process.

put.description:
Pay the invoice generated through a `/login/credentials` **GET** request and then
use `paymentHash` to certify validity and finally create the account.

username.description: User choosen username (May differe from login)

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

post.description: Use existing credentials to log into an account.

username.description: User choosen username (May differe from login)

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

get.description:
LNURL string used to create an account or connect to a existing account.
The user wallet will sign a message using the provided k1 inside the LNURL.
You need to have a session cookie on the browser you are using to log in.

Verify the public key with the signature and the k1 to create a account or connect into a existing account.
The connected state will be push over websocketsto the client.

parameters.name: k1
parameters.description: Hex encoded 32 bytes of challenge which is going to be signed by user private key.

parameters.name: sig
parameters.description: Signature generated by the lightning wallet.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Public key of the lightning wallet.

parameters.name: hmac
parameters.description: HMAC signature used to secure LNURL.

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

get.description: Ask the Lightning wallet to create an invoice with amount and description.

parameters.name: expiry
parameters.description: Timestamp when the LNURL is expired.

callback.description: Callback URL used by the wallet

k1.description: Random hex string to identify the user Lightning Wallet.

get.description: Use LNURL to withdraw from the user balance.

parameters.name: k1
parameters.description: Random hex string to identify the user Lightning Wallet.

post.description:
Use the browser extension [Joule](https://lightningjoule.com/) to authenticate user.
A random message will be signed with the user's wallet private key,
this message will be send with the signature to allow LND to authenticate the user

message.description: Message signed by the wallet private key

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

post.description: Cancel the position linked to the given `pid`.**Only works on positions that are not currently filled**.

requestBody.description: Payload containing the position id that will be cancelled.

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

post.description:
Send the order form parameters to add a new position in database.
**If `type="l"`, the property `price` must be included in the request to know when the position should be filled.**
**You can choose to use the margin or the quantity as a parameter, the other will be calculated with the one you choosed**

requestBody.description: Payload with all the information needed to setup a new position.

type.description: Type of the order (Market or Limit)

side.description: Side of the order (Buy or Sell)

margin.description: Margin or quantity should be filled

quantity.description: Quantity or margin should be filled

price.description: Required when using a limit order

margin.description: Margin used for the position creation

liquidation.description: Liquidation level when the position will be closed

market_wi.description: Market working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

margin_wi.description: Margin working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

stoploss_wi.description: Stoploss working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

takeprofit_wi.description: Takeprofit working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

put.description: Allows user to modify `stoploss` or `takeprofit` parameters of an existing position.

200.description: Says whether or not the position was updated.

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

delete.description:
Close the user position, the PL will be calculated against the current bid or offer
depending on the side of the position

parameters.name: pid
parameters.description: ID of the position to close.

exit_price.description: At which price the position was closed

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

get.description:
Retrieves either opened, closed or all positions.

**If no parameters is sent, the opened positions are fetched by default.**

liquidation.description: Liquidation level when the position will be closed

margin.description: Margin used for the position creation

margin_wi.description: Margin working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

market_wi.description: Market working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

exit_price.description: At which price the position was closed

stoploss_wi.description: Stoploss working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

takeprofit_wi.description: Takeprofit working indicator [filled, running, closed, canceled]

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

get.description: Shows informations about the lightning node.
Fetches UID, username, account type and current balance.

200.description: User found and informations are fetched.

linkingpublickey.description: Public key used for lnurl or joule account

put.description: Update the current password to the requested one.

newPassword.description: New password wanted by the user

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

get.description: Retrieves all withdraw or deposit you did with LN Markets

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Which kind of transactions will be fetched.

did.description: Deposit ID in case of deposit

wid.description: Withdraw ID in case of withdraw

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

get.description: Retrieves the list of active JSON Web Token user currently holds.

delete.description: Using the `jti` parameter, identifies and revoke usage of a given JWT.

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

post.description: Using the given scopes, allow the token bearer to get access to different parts of the public API.

requestBody.description: Scopes of authorization that the token will grant to the bearer.

200.description: Token successfuly created, its Base64URL encoded signature is returned for future use.

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

post.description: Add fund to your LN Markets balance

requestBody.description: Payload that contains all informations to initialize a new deposit.

amount.description: Amount of sat to deposit on the account

200.description: New deposit entry in database waiting for payment. Using `paymentRequest` afterwards, user will confirm the deposit and funds will be added to his account.

paymentRequest.description: Invoice you should pay to add balance to your account

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

post.description: Move funds from the **[Lightning channel](https://medium.com/suredbits/lightning-101-what-are-lightning-channels-cfb80f440298)** with LN Markets to user wallet by using an invoice directly.

requestBody.description: Payload that countains all informations to initiate a new withdraw.

invoice.description: Bolt 11 invoice with the same amount as the request withdraw amount

200.description: Funds are removed from user account and added to user wallet.

paymentsecret.description: Payment secret of the settled invoice

paymenthash.description: Payment hash for the settled invoice

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.

requestBody.description: Amount the user wants to withdraw.

400.description: The request query and / or body does not fit the schema requirements. It can also be raised by parameters leading to unexpected behaviour / results.
